caption:
b'Did you know that 1 in 3 parents don\xe2\x80\x99t have a clear understanding of what their grown children do for a living? Our Families & Allies at BlackRock Network (FAB) works to change that by hosting its annual Take Your Parents to Work Day event.

Recently, we virtually hosted over 950 parents representing 35 countries across six continents to participate in insightful sessions that helped them get a glimpse of what it\xe2\x80\x99s like to work at BlackRock. In addition to English, we offered the event in Spanish for the first time this year. Check out photos of our colleagues and their parents tuning in from home above. Thank you to our colleagues in the FAB Network for organizing another great event! 

#LifeatBlackRock #TakeYourParentsToWorkDay'

b'Happy #GivingTuesday! At BlackRock, we foster a culture of giving year-round through various employee-driven social impact initiatives. For the past few years, our Systematic Active Equities team has put their own fun twist on philanthropic giving by hosting Purple Checkered Shirt Day. Through this event, the team commits to raising funds for local nonprofits of their choice based on the total number of purple checkered shirts worn per team member.

This year, family members and pets were also encouraged to participate and together, the team raised over $60,000! The donations were distributed to charities that work to address the hardships people are facing as a result of the pandemic including @sfmfoodbank, @foodbank4nyc and the UCSF COVID Healthcare Fund, among others.

Check out photos of our colleagues wearing their purple shirts at home above. #SocialImpact #LifeatBlackRock'

b'The EMEA chapter of our Women\xe2\x80\x99s Initiative & Allies Network (WIN) is excited to celebrate the fourth year of WIN Elevate, a six-month career development program offered to female employees at the Associate level. Through sponsorship from senior leaders and technical skill building, the program helps accelerate the careers of women at BlackRock. This year\xe2\x80\x99s cohort consists of more than 50 participants across 10 EMEA offices and 19 business areas. The curriculum includes a Python bootcamp, portfolio construction workshop and a mini-Hackathon challenge focused on BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s racial equity commitments. WIN Elevate is not only a fantastic learning experience, but also a great way for women to build a strong network at the firm.\n \n#WomenWhoLead #WomenSupportingWomen #LifeatBlackRock'

b'At this week\xe2\x80\x99s @lwtech #DEBUG2020 summit, BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Global Head of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Michelle Gadsden-Williams, spoke about advancing #BlackLivesMatter in the workplace. She focused on the role companies can play in supporting diverse talent and BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s racial equity action plan.
\xc2\xa0
In the session, Michelle shared, \xe2\x80\x9cWhen it comes to assessing a company\xe2\x80\x99s Diversity, Equity and Inclusion work, there are three things that I look for: the courage to act, the commitment to lead and the conviction to change.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xc2\xa0
We\xe2\x80\x99re proud of the progress we\xe2\x80\x99ve made toward building a more diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. We will continue to strive to cultivate a culture where all our employees feel like they belong.

#Inclusion #Diversity #LifeatBlackRock #LWTSUMMIT'

b'Today we celebrate #VeteransDay, #ArmisticeDay and #RemembranceDay in many countries across the globe. Each day honors the brave individuals who put their lives on the line to protect our nations and our families. For BlackRock, supporting veterans \xe2\x80\x93 and providing help to them, and their families, as they transition to civilian life \xe2\x80\x93 is a high priority. One way we show this commitment is through our #VestsForVets initiative. Led by our VET & Allies employee network, vests are sold each year to raise money for @acp_usa, a career development and mentorship program for veterans and active duty spouses. VestsForVets participants wear their vests on November 11 to recognize the sacrifices made by veterans around the world. This year alone, the program has raised more than $10,000.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s time to exercise your right to #vote! At BlackRock, we are committed to fostering a culture of civic engagement. We also recognize that voters are facing unique challenges this election cycle. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re partnering with @usvote to provide nonpartisan voting resources to help our employees and their families navigate state-specific or international voting procedures. Democracy only works if people uphold the duty we have as citizens to participate in elections and have access to the information they need to make an informed decision.'

b'Meet Mandeep, a Director in the Aladdin Product Group based in Gurgaon, India. When he began his career, he wanted to work on something that could lead to a positive impact on society and the people around him. He started by building technology solutions for the education sector and learned that through technology, he could transform people's lives for the better.

"Whatever technology solution we are building, that is providing a level-playing field and transparency to investors. That leads to a positive impact on everybody," says Mandeep.

As we celebrate the 20-year anniversary of when BlackRock first offered Aladdin to our clients and peers, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to spotlight employees like Mandeep, who use their passion for technology to have an impact on BlackRock, our clients and the world. 
#LifeatBlackRock #PurposeDriven'

b'We have long supported and believed in cultivating a diverse and inclusive culture \xe2\x80\x93 one in which all employees feel like they belong. In June, we announced an action plan to further advance racial equity and inclusion at BlackRock \xe2\x80\x93 across the globe and in every community we operate in.
 
Recently, more than 200 of our colleagues on the Alternatives Investment team around the globe participated in a solo run/walk to benefit charities that focus on advancing racial equity. The event included a 5K, 10K and other fitness activities like cycling. We even had one open water swimmer in Seattle! :woman_swimming_medium-light_skin_tone::person_biking_medium_skin_tone::woman_running_dark_skin_tone:
 
Through this employee-led initiative, BlackRock was able to donate over $70,000 across @stopwatch_UK, @eji_org, @splcenter, @runnymedetrust and Stand Against Racism & Inequality, among others. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud of the progress we\xe2\x80\x99ve made on our journey toward building a more diverse and equitable workplace and are committed to continuing to make strides to promote racial equity at BlackRock and beyond.
 
#DiversityandInclusion #SocialImpact #LifeatBlackRock'

b'GAIN is our Global Administrative Initiative Network, which engages, fosters, and enhances the career development of our Administrative professionals by providing them with resources for learning and educational tools. We recently launched a global GAIN Book Club to help inspire and connect assistants across the firm. The first book, The Leader Assistant, was written by Jeremy Burrows @go.burrows, who also hosts the Leader Assistant Podcast @leaderassistant.
 
Simone White (pictured above) is an Executive Assistant based in London and Global Chair of GAIN. She was recently featured on Jeremy\xe2\x80\x99s podcast, where she discusses how to help companies value the role of an assistant, owning your role as an assistant and how BlackRock supports assistants.
 
We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to remain invested in our people and continue to provide ample learning and development opportunities for all employees.
 
#AssistantsLead #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Congratulations to six of our colleagues for being recognized by INvolve and Yahoo Finance for their contributions towards gender diversity, equity and inclusion at BlackRock and beyond. INvolve is a global network and consultancy that champions diversity and inclusion in business; their HERoes list is supported by @YahooFinance.

Our passionate colleagues were recognized in three categories:

 :keycap_1: Executives who lead by example and drive change to increase gender diversity::sparkles:Mirjam Staub-Bisang, Head of BlackRock Switzerland and :sparkles:Rachel Lord, Head of BlackRock Europe, Middle East and Africa.

:keycap_2: Senior leaders who advocate and create a more inclusive environment for women: :sparkles:Robert Fairbairn, BlackRock Vice Chairman and :sparkles:Sanjeev Malik, Head of Technology and Operations for Asia-Pacific region.

:keycap_3: Future leaders who are making a significant contribution to diversity at work: :sparkles:KC Boas, Vice President with BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Retirement Group and :sparkles:Divya Steinwall, Head of Sales Enablement for iShares Canada.

(They\xe2\x80\x99re pictured clockwise above)

Click the link in our bio to learn more about these inspiring leaders. :backhand_index_pointing_up_medium-light_skin_tone::backhand_index_pointing_up_medium-light_skin_tone:
#LifeAtBlackRock #Inclusion #Diversity #HERRoleModels20'

b'Back in January, our colleagues in Budapest were doing yoga together in the office every week for a good cause. :person_in_lotus_position_light_skin_tone::woman_in_lotus_position_medium_skin_tone::man_in_lotus_position_medium-light_skin_tone: At BlackRock, we\xe2\x80\x99re continuing to support all aspects of our employees\xe2\x80\x99 well-being, especially mental well-being as we all navigate this difficult time.
\xc2\xa0
Since 2018, we\xe2\x80\x99ve been partnering with @adnijoga, an organization that provides mental health tools through #yoga and #mindfulness to vulnerable populations in Hungary including refugees, young people with disabilities and children living in state care. Together, BlackRock and AdniJo\xcc\x81ga have held over 60 yoga classes for employees in our Budapest office, collecting donations from these sessions to bring the physical and mental benefits of movement, breath and relaxation to people in need. And since quarantine, these classes have started happening virtually!
\xc2\xa0
Beyond employee donations, AdniJo\xcc\x81ga has been awarded two grants through our annual BlackRock Gives grants program which enables employees to get involved in causes they\xe2\x80\x99re passionate about in their communities. Working with AdniJo\xcc\x81ga has allowed us to provide employees with an opportunity to boost their own mental health while also supporting a local non-profit where our employees live and work.
\xc2\xa0
#MentalHealthAwareness #SocialImpact #LifeatBlackRock'

b'As #HispanicHeritageMonth comes to a close, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to spotlight members of our SOMOS Latinx & Allies Network and share why their cultural legacy makes them proud.
 
When we asked Aaron (photo 1), an Associate in Atlanta on the Global Marketing team, what Hispanic Heritage Month means to him, he shared: \xe2\x80\x9cThis time allows us to reflect on Latinx achievements in American society and to bring about cultural awareness. I celebrate my culture and family this month by cooking some of my favorite Hispanic food like mofongo \xe2\x80\x93 a mixture of fried plantains, pork skin and garlic, or flancocho \xe2\x80\x93 a sweet, cake-like custard with caramel sauce. The caldero I\xe2\x80\x99m holding in this picture was passed on to me by mother. I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to take this time to celebrate my Puerto Rican heritage.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
Claudia (photo 2), a Campus Recruiter in NYC, shared that this month is about, \xe2\x80\x9cthe shared language, customs and culture of Spanish-speaking countries \xe2\x80\x93 there\xe2\x80\x99s a connection and sense of community between us all. Growing up, my Colombian father and Ecuadorian mother taught me a lot about my roots, so I have a deep appreciation for our heritage, food, language and history. It is because of my parents that I feel lucky to have a rich cultural background and will pass our Hispanic traditions on to future generations. As a tri-cultural and bilingual individual, being Hispanic is something I will always carry with honor.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
Thank you to Aaron, Claudia and the entire SOMOS community at BlackRock for celebrating Hispanic Heritage Month with us. 

#LifeatBlackRock'

b"In support of #WorldMentalHealthDay, meet Phil Schermer, Chief of Staff to our Global CMO, who is making waves outside of work in the mental health space through his passion project @projecthealthyminds. More than 615 million people around the globe are living with a metal health condition, but 60% don\xe2\x80\x99t get the treatment they need and deserve. We\xe2\x80\x99re incredibly proud to see the impact Phil is making to help people access mental well-being support.\n \nWhen asked how working at BlackRock has enabled him to live his purpose, Phil said: \xe2\x80\x9cI came to BlackRock 7 years ago because I believed in the social conscience that was so unique to BlackRock. What Larry Fink says in his annual CEO letters isn't just hollow writing on the wall here. My story is proof that the senior leaders at the firm encourage and empower employees to get involved in efforts that make our communities healthier and stronger. At a time when both top talent and society are expecting companies to serve all stakeholders, and as we face an unprecedented #mentalhealth crisis in our society, I couldn't be prouder to work at a place like BlackRock that supports its employees' passions and personal endeavors.\xe2\x80\x9d"

b'Looking back at our 2019 San Francisco Giving Days event :up_arrow_selector: 

Our San Francisco office recently hosted its 14th annual Giving Days event, a fundraiser that brings together employees, local businesses and non-profits. This year\xe2\x80\x99s programming took on a virtual format that included a silent auction, fitness class, wine tasting, trivia and more.
 
Through this event, our firm is able to amplify our impact in the San Francisco community. A total of 215 employees participated this year, and together, they were able to raise $750,000 which will be distributed across our 2020 Giving Days beneficiaries including @bgcsf, @compasssf, @missionassetfund and the 49ers Foundation. Thank you to all of our employees and partners who helped make Giving Days 2020 a huge success! #LifeatBlackRock #SocialImpact'

b'Congratulations to Alexis Rosenblum, CFA on being named a 2020 @businessinsider Rising Star of Wall Street! In her role as BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Chief Corporate Sustainability Officer, Alexis oversees how BlackRock executes on its firm-wide sustainability goals by incorporating environmental, social and corporate governance-related issues into our corporate activities. Alexis started in her current role in August 2019 and is the first person to hold this title at the firm.  She has spent her entire career at BlackRock and joined in 2010 through our  Full-Time Analyst Program after completing a summer internship. :clapping_hands_light_skin_tone::clapping_hands_medium-light_skin_tone::clapping_hands_medium_skin_tone::clapping_hands_dark_skin_tone:\n \nWhen asked what this recognition means to her, Alexis shared: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m honored and humbled to be included on the 2020 Rising Stars list! My presence on the list is thanks to the many sponsors and role models I\xe2\x80\x99ve had at BlackRock who have guided and believed in me over the last 10 years.\xe2\x80\x9d #Sustainability #WomenInFinance #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Our Women\xe2\x80\x99s Initiative & Allies Network (WIN) in Singapore recently hosted a cooking class to support @daughtersoftomorrow, a charity that helps women from low-income families find sustained employment and build a better future. The group met in person and virtually to cook and fundraise for the organization. In July, BlackRock employees virtually taught financial literacy skills to women from Daughters of Tomorrow to enable them to cast a wider net for job opportunities.\n \nWe also supported the organization through our 2020 BlackRock Gives grant program, an employee-led initiative that encourages colleagues to nominate nonprofit organizations in their local communities to receive funding. This year, we increased funding for the BlackRock Gives grants by 50%, which enabled us to allocate $4 million to 253 nonprofits across 22 countries. We are proud to support organizations like Daughters of Tomorrow that help increase gender representation in the workforce. #WeAreBlackRock #LifeAtBlackRock #WomenWhoLead'

b'In celebration of Climate Week NYC, meet our Green Team Network at BLK! This employee-led group provides our colleagues with a forum to connect around their shared passion for the environment. Together, they create #sustainability initiatives, share best practices and help steward conservation efforts in our offices. The members of the Green Team Network are critical to advancing a culture of sustainability, not just at BlackRock but also in the communities we operate in. Today, over 2,000 employees are participating in Green Teams in 46 of our offices around the globe.
 
Pictured above is Andreas, a Director on the Financial Markets Advisory team in Athens, participating in the recent \xe2\x80\x9cDo 1 Thing \xe2\x80\x93 At Home\xe2\x80\x9d campaign which encouraged employees to change their daily habits and work towards a world free of plastic waste.
 
We thank our Green Team Network for providing employees with educational resources and inspiration to live and work in a more environmentally responsible way. :globe_showing_Americas::recycling_symbol_selector: 

#ClimateWeek #LifeatBlackRock'

b'For the second year in a row, BlackRock has ranked in the Top 25 on @refinitiv\xe2\x80\x99s Diversity and Inclusion Index \xe2\x80\x93 this year coming in at #1!

When we asked our Global Head of Human Resources, Manish Mehta, what this recognition means for BlackRock he shared: \xe2\x80\x9cWe are grateful to be recognized by Refinitiv for our commitment to diversity and inclusion. BlackRock is dedicated to continuing to develop and recruit people from all backgrounds who can help us deliver positive outcomes for our clients, the firm and society.\xe2\x80\x9d

The index ratings used to identify and rank the top 100 organizations are informed by Refinitiv\xe2\x80\x99s Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) data, covering close to 10,000 companies around the globe. #Inclusion #Diversity #LifeatBlackRock'

b"Why is diversity important in finance? 

Meet Daisy, an Analyst in the Global Provider Strategy group based in San Francisco. She has been answering that question and demonstrating the value of diversity throughout her career. In celebration of #HispanicHeritageMonth in the U.S., Daisy\xe2\x80\x99s story exemplifies how our Hispanic and Latinx colleagues are essential in delivering better outcomes for our communities and clients.

Daisy's parents immigrated from Mexico, and their highest level of education is elementary school. Her family experienced financial hardship while she was growing up, and she knew that she needed to work hard in order to give back to others. 

When she was in college, Daisy applied to the BlackRock Founders Scholarship, which is an accelerated internship interview process and scholarship program for students from underrepresented groups who have demonstrated leadership in their communities. By being at BlackRock, she is able to be part of the bigger story, and mentor others who have the same questions she had when first starting out her career. 

#LifeatBlackRock #PurposeDriven #Mentorship"

b'Congratulations to Daniel Gamba, CFA, on his new role as Chair of the Board of Governors of the @CFAInstitute! Daniel is the Co-Head of Fundamental Equities at BlackRock and serves as Co-Chair of the SOMOS Latinx Network, our community for Latinx/Hispanic employees and their allies. The CFA Institute is the global association of #investmentmanagement professionals, and Daniel will be the first person of Latin American descent to serve as Chair of the Institute\xe2\x80\x99s board. :clapping_hands_medium-light_skin_tone::clapping_hands_medium-dark_skin_tone::clapping_hands_dark_skin_tone:\n \nWhen asked what this new role means to him, Daniel shared: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m committed to supporting the leadership of the CFA Institute to continue its mission to lead the investment profession globally by promoting the highest standards of ethics, education and professional excellence. I\xe2\x80\x99m also humbled to assume this new role as the first Board Chair of Latin American descent. With more than 178,000 CFA charterholders in 164 markets around the globe, the CFA Institute reflects the rich diversity of investors worldwide.\xe2\x80\x9d #Inclusion #Diversity #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Meet some members of our ETF and Index Investments ("EII") Portfolio Management group. Fun fact about the team: most of the assets are run by women!
 
Yanfei (photo 1) is a Vice President based in London. #WFH has definitely brought new levels of excitement to her household. To start, her 13-month-old just learned how to walk by grabbing the computer mouse and speed walking away! Ever since, working from home with a toddler has meant planning ahead and being more reliant on technology. Yanfei and the rest of the team ensure #investors are getting what they need in a virtual world by staying connected with colleagues, clients and with what\xe2\x80\x99s going on in financial markets around the globe. Yanfei explains, \xe2\x80\x9cdespite being physically separated, we are more closely connected than ever before.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
Funmi (photo 2) is a Vice President based in San Francisco. When asked about her transition to WFH life, she described, \xe2\x80\x9cas a portfolio engineer, focus and precision are essential to achieving superior outcomes for our clients. For me, having a fully functional workspace complete with a stand-up desk is essential to maintaining that focus and precision. I am also really grateful to be healthy and safe.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
While #technology enables us to do our jobs and remain connected to our teams, our people are what truly drive innovation and collaboration at BlackRock every day. 

#LifeatBlackRock #WeAreBlackRock'

b"We\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled to host one week of the 2020 Fast Forward Accelerator, a program for 9 innovative startups building #tech in areas ranging from emergency communications to mental health and immigration. Last year, we hosted the first ever NYC Fast Forward Demo Day and awarded @amplelabs_co a grant following an employee-driven vote. Fast Forward's program is virtual this year and continues to provide an incredible opportunity for startups to showcase the importance of technology\xe2\x80\x99s ability to accelerate innovation and drive social change. #TechForGood #FFWD20 #LifeatBlackRock"

b"In honor of women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment and in celebration of the 100-year anniversary of women\xe2\x80\x99s right to vote in the U.S., we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to share this story.
 
Meet Alicia, a member of our Mexico Sales Wealth team. In Mexico, many people feel that women can only have two roles: housewife and mother. However, Alicia's mother and grandmother both worked throughout her childhood, showing her that she could be both a mother and a professional. 

Today, Alicia is a leader in our Women's Initiative & Allies employee network and a co-founder of Mujeres en Finanzas (Women in Finance)\xe2\x80\x94a community that offers mentorship, trainings and seminars, among other things, to help women advance in their careers.

In the business of building financial futures, half of those futures are women. Alicia\xe2\x80\x99s story is an inspiring reminder that although there has been much progress, there is still work to be done around the world. 

#WomenInspiringWomen #LifeatBlackRock #PurposeDriven"

b'We recently crossed the finish line of our annual Global Challenge focused on employees\xe2\x80\x99 physical well-being. This year\xe2\x80\x99s friendly competition, called \xe2\x80\x9cThrive Together, Wherever,\xe2\x80\x9d brought together colleagues from 30 countries and formed 632 teams to compete in fitness-focused activities. :flexed_biceps_medium-light_skin_tone::flexed_biceps_medium-dark_skin_tone::flexed_biceps_dark_skin_tone:
 
Check out some of the different ways our colleagues are focusing on physical well-being in the photos above. 

Photo 1: Meet Linda, the manager of our Stockholm office and two-time Swedish Team Championship award winner of Kyudo. She has been practicing this form of Japanese archery for years and is currently managing the National Kyudo team as they train for the European 2021 Championship. Good luck, Linda!

Photo 2: Meet Sonya, a member of our Sales Enablement team in Toronto and certified #fitness instructor. Here, she\xe2\x80\x99s doing an outdoor HIIT workout and will be hosting a virtual workout class for our Associates Arena professional network next month.
 
Photo 3: Meet Andrea, a member of our Portfolio Compliance team in Delaware and competitive adult figure skater representing America\xe2\x80\x99s oldest figure skating club. She recently hosted a virtual athletic training and Pilates fusion workout for members of our OUT & Allies employee network.
 
We\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled to see our employees prioritizing their physical well-being and will continue to provide outlets for them to do so. #LifeatBlackRock #WeAreBlackRock'

b'Last week, Trisha King, a member of our Employer Brand team in NYC, sat down (virtually of course) with the CEO of @themuse to talk about what it\xe2\x80\x99s like to lead your employees through a crisis. Focused on how BlackRock is defining its legacy during the COVID-19 #pandemic, the conversation covered how we\xe2\x80\x99ve remained authentic as a brand, supportive to our employees and loyal to our values as an organization. Trisha also reflected on her personal journey during this time of change: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve been focusing on trying to build my resilience. One example of something I\xe2\x80\x99ve been able to take advantage of at BLK is free access to the Calm app which reminds me to focus on my well-being.\xe2\x80\x9d\n \nWhile navigating these unprecedented times is challenging, we continue to support our employees in all aspects of their lives. #LifeatBlackRock #WeAreBlackRock'

b'This week, we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to welcome our 2020 Analyst class to BlackRock!:balloon:\n\nNearly 400 Analysts have joined us from 162 universities around the globe, and they will be based across 22 offices and 14 countries once we all return to work as normal. Our new colleagues have begun their careers at BlackRock with a two-week, virtual (for the first time ever!) orientation. Pictured above are some of our new joiners from New York, Toronto, Edinburgh and Atlanta. We look forward to helping each and every Analyst learn, grow and thrive as a part of our BlackRock family. #LifeatBlackRock #WeAreBlackRock'

b"Meet Kenneth, a Director on BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s U.S. Private Credit team and Regional Lead for the Southern region. From an early age, Kenneth learned about the importance of providing for one\xe2\x80\x99s community \xe2\x80\x93 a value he strives to live by to this day. When he came to Atlanta to begin his career more than a decade ago, Kenneth was looking for ways to volunteer his time and talents towards local community impact projects. 
 
At BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Atlanta office, known as the Innovation Hub, we're bringing together the best and brightest talent. We\xe2\x80\x99re also dedicated to social impact, and work with nonprofit organizations in Atlanta and beyond, that help make our communities stronger and more resilient.

Kenneth and his family regularly volunteer with Meals on Wheels, creating long-lasting impact and helping their community thrive. 

#LifeatBlackRock #PurposeDriven"

b'Happy #NationalInternDay :party_popper::balloon:Earlier this month, we welcomed 478 students from around the globe to BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Summer Analyst class of 2020! In response to the global pandemic, we\xe2\x80\x99re delivering this year\xe2\x80\x99s #internship program in a fully virtual format. We chatted with Eddie, an intern within the Aladdin Product Group, to hear about his experience as a virtual intern. Here\xe2\x80\x99s what he had to say:
 
\xe2\x80\x9cBefore COVID-19, I was set to work in BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s San Francisco office, but now I\xe2\x80\x99m working from my apartment in Madison, Wisconsin. Although my team and I are physically hundreds or even thousands of miles apart, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been able to use the tools and technology we have to connect with them and build relationships with my fellow interns. My internship experience so far has taught me how to adapt to situations that are completely out of my control. I realize how fortunate I am to still have the opportunity to work at BlackRock despite the pandemic so I\xe2\x80\x99ve been making sure to ask questions and look for opportunities to learn so I can get the most out of the experience.\xe2\x80\x9d 

Check out our stories to hear more about #LifeatBlackRock from our summer interns. 

#WeAreBlackRock #WorkFromHome'

b'For the past 5 years, we\xe2\x80\x99ve had the opportunity to welcome a group of students into our offices through the @girlswhocode Summer Immersion Program. Due to COVID-19, we\xe2\x80\x99re hosting our first ever virtual program with #GirlsWhoCode this year which includes two sessions, one in New York City and the other in San Francisco. These two-week programs consist of virtual coding classes, college-readiness discussions and tech career panels with senior members of our Aladdin Product Group. And in 2019, the group in NYC even went on a field trip to @nbc (as shown here)!\n \nThe level of engagement from students has been amazing so far and we\xe2\x80\x99re honored that these 60 young women chose to spend a part of their summer with us. We can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see what they\xe2\x80\x99ll achieve in the future! We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to partner with Girls Who Code, an organization helping advance the diversity of future technologists. #WomeninTech #DiversityinTech'

b"Congratulations to KC Boas, a Vice President with BlackRock's Retirement Group, on being named one of @CrainsNewYork\xe2\x80\x99s 20 in their 20s. When asked what this recognition means to her, KC shared, \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m both honored and humbled to be included on this list of amazing movers and shakers in New York business. It\xe2\x80\x99s also a deeply motivating reminder that we must continue to work to ensure that a dignified retirement is within reach for everyone. I\xe2\x80\x99m inspired by my colleagues who push me to strive for more each and every day \xe2\x80\x93 and I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful to my mentors and sponsors who lift me up along the way. Together, we\xe2\x80\x99re working to fulfill BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s purpose of helping more and more people experience financial well-being \xe2\x80\x93 talk about a meaningful way to spend your 9-to-5!\xe2\x80\x9d #WomeninFinance #CrainsNY20s :clapping_hands_medium-dark_skin_tone::clapping_hands_medium-light_skin_tone::clapping_hands_dark_skin_tone:"

b"Meet Ravi, a member of the Executive Recruiting team in London. One of his biggest passions is sports, and he views his role as a recruiter like that of a sports agent: hire people irrespective of where they come from, recognize hard work, and give everyone an equal opportunity to succeed. 

Ravi believes that no matter what field you're in, whether it's sports or business, it's always about being given the opportunity. 

#LifeatBlackRock #PurposeDriven"

b'Meet our future workplace superstars! We recently hosted a virtual Kid\xe2\x80\x99s Day for parents at BLK and their children to participate in sessions around financial literacy, social impact, meditation and more. Over 240 children joined this year! They also learned about how BlackRock employees are helping lead sustainability initiatives and environmental change in the world. Throughout the day, the children created signs to share how they want to help the planet or their community and even learned how to plant an indoor terrarium using a glass jar, rocks and some greenery. :woman_artist_medium_skin_tone::herb::globe_showing_Americas:#TakeYourKidsToWorkDay #TheFutureIsBright #LifeAtBlackRock'

b'Congratulations to Chanel Frazier, Head of Business Strategy for BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Portfolio Management Group, on being named one of the EMpower Top 100 Ethnic Minority Executive Role Models of 2020 by @yahoofinance! When asked to reflect on what this award means to her, Chanel shared: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m honored and humbled to be listed among this group of remarkable global leaders. Now, more than ever, we need to continue the discussion about the importance of racial and ethnic diversity in the workplace. The only way we can move the dial is to acknowledge the gaps and take intentional actions towards resolution. Thank you to my colleagues who are working beside me to ensure that our efforts are not just part of a moment, but rather part of a movement.\xe2\x80\x9d :raising_hands_dark_skin_tone::raising_hands_medium-light_skin_tone::raising_hands_medium-dark_skin_tone: #EMRoleModels20 #RoleModels #Inclusion #Diversity'

b':rainbow_flag_selector:Happy Pride everyone!:rainbow_flag_selector: Last week, members of our OUT & Allies Network hosted their first global #LGBTQ Spirit Day by encouraging employees to visibly demonstrate the spirit of #pride during calls and meetings or while going about their days at home. Although we were unable to celebrate together in person this year, we were still able to come together as a community to showcase our collective pride during this important time. #PrideMonth #LifeAtBlackRock'

b"Meet Jeff, a FinTech Business Strategist with the Aladdin Product Group in New York City and Co-Chair of BlackRock's Out & Allies Network which currently includes 1100+ employees around the globe. Coming out changed Jeff's life for the better, and working at BlackRock for the last decade has shown him it's possible to combine his identity and professional aspirations. Through his work with the network, Jeff advocates for other #LGBTQ people both inside and outside of BlackRock every single day.\n\nMost recently, our OUT & Allies Network harnessed the scale of BlackRock to help push for federal legislation protecting LGBT employees in the U.S. from discrimination which the Supreme Court ruled in favor of just last week. Although work remains to ensure every citizen has equal protection under the law, this ruling is a historic gain for Civil Rights! :rainbow: :rainbow_flag_selector: #LifeatBlackRock #PrideMonth #PurposeDriven"

b'Francesca Sesia, Head of Marketing for BlackRock Italy, was recently named one of @Forbes 100 Most Successful Women in Italy. When asked what three traits led to this recognition, Francesca shared \xe2\x80\x9cpassion, drive and constructive dialogue.\xe2\x80\x9d She embodies these qualities while working closely with leaders in Italy and around the globe to ensure our marketing strategy for the country aligns with broader firm-wide priorities. With a degree in engineering and a background in strategy consulting, Francesca brings a unique and #innovative perspective to her role. \xe2\x80\x9cAt a company like BlackRock, you never stop learning! I\xe2\x80\x99m always looking for new challenges to confront and problems to solve.\xe2\x80\x9d Congratulations, Francesca! :clapping_hands_light_skin_tone::clapping_hands_medium_skin_tone::clapping_hands_medium-dark_skin_tone: #WomenWhoLead #Forbes100'

b'At BlackRock, we work every day to bring our purpose to life, and we wanted to find out more about how our employees are leveraging their passions and strengths to do the same for themselves. So we asked them one of the biggest questions out there: What\xe2\x80\x99s Your Why? \nOver the coming months, we\xe2\x80\x99ll be sharing stories from our employees about how they connect their personal purpose to their work at BlackRock. Today, meet Debbie McCoy, Head of Sustainable Investing with the Systemic Active Equity group. She believes that more flourishing in the world can come from companies, and through her work she can be a part of the changes she hopes to see.  #LifeAtBlackRock #Sustainability #PurposeDriven'

b'In light of the recent events of racial injustice and violence, we invited Dr. Laura Morgan Roberts, Professor of Practice at the University of Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s Darden School of Business and an expert on diversity and leadership, to join us for a conversation with employees. The discussion centered around racial dynamics in the workplace and how organizations can come together to create a more inclusive culture for Black employees as well as other minorities. This work is necessary. We must continue to create the space \xe2\x80\x93 at work, at home and beyond \xe2\x80\x93 for conversations on race, identity and inequality.\n\nThis event is part of an ongoing series of internal dialogues at BlackRock that will hopefully lead us to a place of greater cultural competence, understanding and empathy. Thank you to Dr. Morgan Roberts for sharing your knowledge and research with us and to our Black Professionals & Allies Network for hosting this important event. #AmplifyBlackVoices'

b'LGBTQ Pride Month is celebrated each June in many places around the globe, with its origins traced to the watershed 1969 Stonewall Uprising in New York City. \xe2\x80\x9cIn this time, it is important that we celebrate #Pride and acknowledge the legal and social progress that has been gained by the LGBTQ community through decades of sustained activism and allyship of others. In the true spirit of Pride, it is our responsibility to stand in solidarity and with the Black community, take action against injustice and advocate for our Black colleagues, many of whom are also members of the LGBTQ+ community. Your fight for equality is our fight as well.\xe2\x80\x9d - Kirsty and Jeff, Co-Chairs of BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s OUT & Allies Network. #PrideMonth #Allyship'

b'Gavin Lewis, Managing Director at BlackRock, and co-founder of #TalkAboutBlack, has launched a new campaign alongside The Diversity Project and #TalkAboutBlack to raise awareness of the everyday fight black people must endure against racist stereotypes. The #IAM campaign encourages black people and non-black allies to answer the question \xe2\x80\x9cwho are you?\xe2\x80\x9d in a photo of themselves alongside the hashtag.'

b'Over the weekend, our CEO Larry Fink shared a letter to all employees globally addressing the recent tragic events of racial injustice in the U.S. Here\'s what he has to say: \xe2\x80\x9cThe past few weeks have been deeply painful for the Black community. The murders of Ahmaud Arbery and George Floyd, and the incident in Central Park, show how much work we have to do to build a stronger, more equal, and safer society. For our employees suffering pain from these tragedies, know that the firm\xe2\x80\x99s leadership stands with you, and we are listening. We will do everything we can to support you and give you the space to express your feelings and concerns."'

b'Meet Abby, the Head of BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Princeton office as well as the Head of Client Experience in North America. During #quarantine, Abby has spent a lot of time at the sewing machine making masks. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s been a nice creative outlet while at the same time providing friends, neighbors and #essentialworkers with their own masks.\xe2\x80\x9d Thank you to Abby for putting her creative talents to use for a good cause, and to the many employees across BLK who are finding ways to #giveback to their local communities during this difficult time. #WeAreBlackRock #LifeAtBlackRock'

b'Happy #WorldMeditationDay! As we all do our best to cope with these uncertain times, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to pause and take a deep breath. Many of our employees have turned to the BlackRock Mindfulness group for resources and support \xe2\x80\x93 this group even hosts a daily guided meditation session which is open to colleagues all over the globe! And with the help of the @Calm app, BlackRock employees now have access to #mindfulness content anywhere, anytime, based on their own schedules. What are you doing to enhance your #wellbeing today? #WeAreBlackRock #LifeAtBlackRock #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth #CalmTogether'

b'Now, more than ever, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to prioritize mental health and #wellbeing. This week, we spoke with Jamal (Associate, Digital Marketing, NYC). Here\xe2\x80\x99s what he had to say: \xe2\x80\x9cI started personal training as a way to support myself financially during grad school, and now #fitness is a way that I support myself physically and emotionally as a working professional. I use the same drive, determination and motivation to push through a challenging workout, as I do to push through a project or deadline at work. With so much change in the world right now, working out helps me feel strong and confident because I dedicated a portion of my day to doing something good for myself.\xe2\x80\x9d Thank you to Jamal for hosting a virtual fitness class last week for our OUT & Allies Network members around the globe. :person_lifting_weights_medium-dark_skin_tone::person_lifting_weights_medium_skin_tone::person_lifting_weights_medium-light_skin_tone: #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth #WeAreBlackRock #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Meet Kathy (center), mother of one and BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Global Head of Leadership and Manager Development based out of our NYC office. \xe2\x80\x9cThe emotional and mental transition to #workingfromhome has been tough, but we are managing. I\xe2\x80\x99m lucky in so many ways: My unused basement became my workspace, my mom lives with us, we have a small backyard and my wife\xe2\x80\x99s work schedule is flexible.\xe2\x80\x9d #WeAreBlackRock #LifeAtBlackRock'

b'Meet Katharine, mother of four and Head of EMEA Credit Product Strategy based in London. \xe2\x80\x9cIn addition to my existing roles of mum, wife, football team administrator, charity volunteer, home help, chauffeur and Managing Director at BlackRock, I can now add IT consultant as my days are filled with cries of \xe2\x80\x98Mum, the internet\xe2\x80\x99s gone down and I\xe2\x80\x99m in a lesson!\xe2\x80\x99 Outside of the internet crashing regularly, #workingfromhome has given me the opportunity to spend time with the children. We\xe2\x80\x99re all taking pleasure in simple pursuits such as bike rides and zoom bingo with Grandma.\xe2\x80\x9d #WeAreBlackRock #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Meet Jennifer, mother of five and Portfolio Manager at BlackRock in San Francisco. \xe2\x80\x9cWith schools and childcare closed, family who would normally help unavailable and a #firstresponder husband who works 24-hour shifts, I\xe2\x80\x99m managing a lot more than my portfolios these days! I\xe2\x80\x99m ever so thankful for our good health and have never appreciated teachers more.\xe2\x80\x9d #WorkFromHome #WeAreBlackRock #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Meet Hui Shan, mother of three and a Vice President on BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Southeast Asia Client Business team in Singapore. \xe2\x80\x9cWorking from home with three boys under the age of two takes multi-tasking to a whole new level! The #quarantine experience redefines what it means to be a #workingmom and it amazes me how much I can achieve for both my family at home and the BlackRock family. A huge shout out to all super mommies out there!\xe2\x80\x9d #WorkFromHome #WeAreBlackRock #LifeatBlackRock'

b'Meet Kanisha, mother of two and a Director on BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Platform Innovation team in New York City. \xe2\x80\x9cThe uncertainty we face has underscored the value of the human connection, the importance of being able to adapt quickly and the necessity of collaboratively working together. Despite the daily challenges of being a working mother during this surreal time, I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful for \xe2\x80\x98my village\xe2\x80\x99 on a personal level and within the global BlackRock community.\xe2\x80\x9d #WeAreBlackRock #LifeAtBlackRock'

b'Today is #MothersDay in many countries around the globe. To honor the many amazing moms at BlackRock, we\xe2\x80\x99ll be showcasing their #workfromhome stories all week long. \nMeet Melanie, mother to a 10-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son. In addition to her day job, she is the Chair of Families at BlackRock in New York, one of our employee networks. \xe2\x80\x9cBeing an administrative assistant is helpful as logistics and organization come naturally to me. It certainly takes a lot of patience, reassurance and snuggles, but we are making it through and thriving as a family.\xe2\x80\x9d Stay tuned for more stories from different moms across BLK! #WeAreBlackRock #LifeAtBlackRock'

b'We don\xe2\x80\x99t stand still at BlackRock. Last week, more than 125 of our colleagues from around the globe took part in the BlackRock Ride and Run charity event. Together, they raised over $30,000 for #covid19 relief efforts in support of @teamrubiconuk and @feedingamerica. Thank you to all who joined us to #workoutathome with purpose. #OneBlackRock #WeAreBlackRock #TogetherWeRide :flexed_biceps_medium_skin_tone::flexed_biceps_medium-light_skin_tone::flexed_biceps_light_skin_tone:'

b'Congratulations:clapping_hands_medium-light_skin_tone:to BlackRock\xe2\x80\x99s Anne Ackerley (right), Barbara Novick (middle), and Carolyn Weinberg (left) who were named to Barron\xe2\x80\x99s 100 Most Influential Women in U.S. Finance list, which honors women across the industry for their leadership, accomplishments, and contributions. #IWD2020'

b'Earlier this month, our Atlanta office hosted its inaugural #blackhistorymonth kick-off event at the National Center for Civil and Human Rights. Speakers shared perspectives and personal stories and discussed what Black History Month meant to them. Thanks to all who joined us!'
location_name: National Center for Civil and Human Rights

caption: b'We recently hosted our #FinTech Uncovered event in #Atlanta for college students. This exploratory day gave students an in-depth look at how finance and #technology are applied across several of our businesses. Thanks to all who participated!'
